title.text: Indexing with WordNet synsets can improve text retrieval

abstractContent.text: The classical, vector space model for text retrieval is shown to give better results (up to 29% better in our experiments) if WordNet synsets are chosen as the indexing space, instead of word forms.
This result is obtained fora manually disambiguated test collection (of queries and documents) derived from the SEMCOR semantic concordance.
The sensitivity of retrieval performance to (automatic) disam-biguation errors when indexing documents is also measured.
Finally, it is observed that if queries are not disambiguated, indexing by synsets performs (at best) only as good as standard word indexing.
